result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Pimental was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kevin M Pimental
Current: W1430 Cty Rd V, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2016)
Prior: W1403 Cth V, Berlin, WI 54923

8:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by DA - agreement has been reached, upon plea to the charge, will recommend a fine and costs and repeater will be dismissed.  Statement by defendant - concurs and makes further statement - DA agrees not to request probation as he provided proof of AODA assessment to the DA.  DA concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to DC and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Statement by defendant regarding DNA sample and fee.  Statement by the court.

Court adjourned at 8:26 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant called and requested his court date be changed to an earlier time as he has orientation for a new job.  Changed to 8:15 a.m. on same date.
43
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.

9:25 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and has reached an agreement.  ADA recites agreement - will plea to the charge and the repeater will be dismissed.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on March 29, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:28 a.m.

10:10 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.  Statement by DA - hearing is March 8, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.

9:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 8, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to meet with the DA before that court date.

Court adjourned at 9:13 a.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns.

Statement by the court - finds probable cause.  Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Ryan W and Wolff's Den Bar in Berlin, WI.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns.
